api

Interface IndexedNavigableRootedNeighborGraph<S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
    All Superinterfaces:
    IndexedNeighborGraph<S>, NavigableRootedNeighborGraph<S>, NeighborGraph<S>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IndexedColorGraph<S,C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BreadthFirstNeighborGraphBuilder, IndexedColorGraphBase, IndexedColorGraphBuilder, IndexedNavigableRootedNeighborGraphBase

    public interface IndexedNavigableRootedNeighborGraph<S>
extends NavigableRootedNeighborGraph<S>, IndexedNeighborGraph<S>
    Conjunction of the NavigableRootedNeighborGraph and IndexedNeighborGraph interfaces, designed as an API for graphs whose construction algorithms are of a breadth-first nature. The indexing is intended to be implemented so as to index the vertices according the insertion order by a builder class that implements the ModifiableNeighborGraph interface. In this way, the set of vertices of any given path-distance from the root will consist of an interval under the indexing. This interface includes three global graph methods for querying the following:
        (i) the path-distance of any given vertex from the root vertex.
       (ii) the maximum path-distance from the root, among all vertices of the graph.
      (iii) the set of vertices of any given path-distance from the root vertex.
    Author:
    pdokos

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDistanceFromTheRoot(S s)
      Returns the path-distance of s from the root.
      int getMaxDistanceFromRoot()
      Returns the maximum path-distance from the root, among all vertices of the graph.
      java.util.List<S> getShell(int d)
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of vertices of path-distance d from the root, ordered by index.

      • Methods inherited from interface api.NeighborGraph
